meanings.definition: An inscription on a building or statue.
meanings.sent1: The epigraph on the ancient statue told a story of bravery.
meanings.sent2: The epigraph on the memorial building honored the fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids added their own epigraph to the school wall.
meanings.sent4: The epigraph on the castle gate seemed to whisper secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The intricate epigraph on the temple entrance was a work of art.

meanings.definition: A quotation at the beginning of a book or chapter.
meanings.sent1: The author chose a meaningful epigraph for the opening chapter.
meanings.sent2: The epigraph at the start of the novel set the tone for the story.
meanings.sent3: The humorous epigraph made readers smile before diving into the book.
meanings.sent4: The epigraph acted as a guiding light for readers entering the story.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious epigraph hinted at the twists to come in the book.

meanings.definition: A short poem or verse at the beginning of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The poet included a heartfelt epigraph before the first stanza.
meanings.sent2: The epigraph added depth to the beginning of the short story.
meanings.sent3: The playful epigraph made readers curious about the following poem.
meanings.sent4: The epigraph served as a poetic doorway into the literary piece.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful epigraph set the mood for the entire collection of poems.
